generatedTitle: Understanding and Preventing Mute Swan Attacks on Humans

extractFactDictList.question: What are mute swans known for?
extractFactDictList.sentence: They are known for their beautiful white plumage and their graceful, sweeping wings.
extractFactDictList.phrase: Beautiful white plumage and graceful, sweeping wings

extractFactDictList.question: Why do mute swans attack humans?
extractFactDictList.sentence: There are several reasons why mute swans may attack humans. One of the most common reasons is that the swan feels threatened or cornered. Mute swans are large birds and can be quite intimidating, especially when they are protecting their young or their territory. If a human comes too close to a mute swan, the bird may feel threatened and lash out. Another reason why mute swans may attack humans is if they feel that their territory is being invaded. Mute swans are very territorial birds and will defend their nesting and breeding grounds fiercely. If a human enters their territory, the swan may see them as a threat and attack. Mute swans may also attack humans if they are in pain or injured. If a swan is hurt or feeling ill, it may become aggressive and lash out at anything that comes near it, including humans.
extractFactDictList.phrase: Feeling threatened, feeling that their territory is being invaded, being in pain or injured

extractFactDictList.question: How can attacks by mute swans on humans be prevented?
extractFactDictList.sentence: There are several steps that can be taken to prevent attacks on humans by mute swans. One of the most important things is to give the swan plenty of space and avoid approaching it too closely. If a mute swan is nesting or breeding, it is best to give the area a wide berth and avoid disturbing the birds in any way. It is also important to be aware of the behavior of mute swans and to recognize the signs of aggression.
extractFactDictList.phrase: Give the swan plenty of space, avoid disturbing nesting or breeding area, be aware of the swans' behavior and recognize signs of aggression
